introduction.para: This document details the procedure for installing the lighting system on a bicycle.

work_area.para: Impacted zones: Zone 200, Zone 300, and Zone 130.

list.item: Remove the lighting system from its packaging.
Verify that all components match the parts list in document .
Apply protective strip around the handlebar.
Open the clamp and position it around the protective strip, ensuring the light connector is at the top.
Install the washer on the screw.
Tighten the screw into the hole at the bottom of the clamp using the correct screwdriver from the toolset.
Apply protective strip around one of the rear triangle up-tubes.
Open the clamp and position it around the protective strip, ensuring the light connector points rearward.
Install the washer on the screw.
Tighten the screw into the hole at the bottom of the clamp using the correct screwdriver from the toolset.
Attach the light with the white glass to the front connector.
Attach the light with the red glass to the rear connector.

step.title: Circuit Breaker Installation (Conditional)
step.note: Installation varies based on bike type.

list.item: Install circuit breaker CBLGT-1001-R on the right handlebar using the clamping ring.
Connect the circuit breaker electrical wire to the rear connector of the front light.
Secure the wire to the frame using a protective strip.
Install circuit breaker CBLGT-1001-L on the left handlebar using the clamping ring.
Connect the circuit breaker electrical wire to the rear connector of the front light.
Secure the wire to the frame using a protective strip.
